Hyle that the Sunne with his beames hot,</br>Scorched the fruits in vale and mountaine:</br>Philon the sheperd late forgot,</br>Sitting besides a Christall fountaine,</br>In shadow of a greene Oke tree,</br>Uppon his Pipe this song playd he:</br>Untrue love, untrue love, untrue love,</br>Adew love, adew love, your mind is light,</br>Your minde is light, soone lost for new love.

So long as I was in your sight,</br>I was as your hart, your soule, your treasure,</br>And evermore you sobb'd, you sigh'd,</br>Burning in flames beyond all measure,</br>Three dayes endur'd your Love to me,</br>And it was lost in other three.</br>Adew love adew love untrue love,</br>Untrue love untrue love adew love,</br>Your mynd is light, soone lost for new love.

Another shepherd you dyd see,</br>To whome your hart was soone enchayned,</br>Full soone your love was leapt from me,</br>Full soone my place he had obtayned,</br>Soone came a third your love to winne,</br>And we were cut and he was in,</br>Adew love, &c.

Sure you have made me passing glad,</br>That you your mynd so soone removed,</br>Before that I the leysrue had,</br>To chuse you for my best beloved,</br>For all my love was past and doonne,</br>Two dayes before it was begoonne.</br>Adew Love &c.</br>
